newsitem.title: USA: Siebel stock rises on software deal with Compaq.
newsitem.headline: Siebel stock rises on software deal with Compaq.

text.p: Siebel Systems Inc. stock rose sharply Tuesday after the tele-marketing management software company said Compaq Computer Corp. will help in the development and sale of its software.
Shares of Siebel, based in San Mateo, Calif., were up $1.25 at $20.25 in early afternoon Nasdaq trading. Earlier, the shares traded as high as $21.25.

Siebel writes computer programmes that help sales managers and telephone marketing companies keep track of sales leads and customer history. Siebel said Compaq, the world's biggest personal computer company, will help it develop, test and sell its software products.
As part of the agreement, Compaq will train its resellers and distributors in installing Siebel software for corporate customers, the companies said.
